comment._content: The microphone in front of the chaps in suits is an AWA Reiss...they were used in the 1920s and early 1930s for outside broadcasts. The presence of a microphone suggests that the broadcast might have been made from this vessel...and if this were the case, I suspect the chap on the other side of the skylight might be looking after another microphone/s which would have been used to record the band... Over at SLNSW there is a wonderful Sam Hood pic of former Australian cricket captain Monty Noble addressing the crowd at the SCG in December 1928, when a presentation was made to Jack Hobbs...in the SLNSW pic we see ?a member of the sound crew holding one of these mikes...look at image number 24 in the album - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=153684&amp... ; If anyone is interested, there's some fantastic background on early microphones and sound equipment put together by the late Colin MacKinnon here - www.qsl.net/vk2dym/radio/mike.htm
